item.title: Mathematical Communication Theory
item.description:
Introduction

The foundations of information theory were laid by Shannon[1], building upon earlier work in computability by Turing[2].

Mathematical Formulation

Shannon’s entropy is defined as:

$$ H(X) = -\sum_{i=1}^{n} P(x_i) \log_2 P(x_i) $$

This can be related to Einstein’s[3] work in statistical mechanics.

Inline math also works: The energy-mass equivalence is $E = mc^2$.

More Complex Equations

The Gaussian integral[3]:

$$ \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-\frac{x^2}{2}} dx = \sqrt{2\pi} $$

Matrix notation:

$$ \mathbf{A} = \begin{bmatrix} a_{11} & a_{12} \ a_{21} & a_{22} \end{bmatrix} $$
